Posts.EditableText:
You can easily hide the text input prompt, but the only "hacky" part to simulating a game book in TA mode is that you need to disable the "auto-echo" code in HandleCommand, where it prints out what you just input. A command link just simulates a command as if you entered it yourself, so that command text will get echoed, which might not be what you want.(I know I didn't.)

Basically, your command links become the means for the player to input commands, and they look just as if the player had entered that text at the command prompt when they click (so you still use the parser to handle that). But from the player's point of view, they're just clicking links.
